intro: Rosa davidii var. fangii, commonly known as the Fang's David rose, is a rare and ornamental shrub native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, semi-double to fully double pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features thorny stems with dark green, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and aesthetic appeal, it is highly valued in horticulture and conservation efforts.
